info.description: The ECommerce Bridge provides a process for syncing eCommerce data into HubSpot by defining mappings from your data schema to what is stored in HubSpot and applying those mappings each time data is sent. To learn more about the motivations, use cases, and see a walkthrough, check out [the overview docs](https://git.hubteam.com/HubSpot/IntegrationsPlatform-ECommBridge/blob/master/docs/api/reference.md)
info.title: ECommerce Bridge

tags.name: Install
tags.description: Install or uninstall the ECommerce Bridge in your HubSpot portal. Not needed for app developers.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Configuration settings for your application or portal

tags.name: Batch Import
tags.description: Synchronize eCommerce Data to HubSpot in large batches

tags.name: Sync
tags.description: Synchronize changes in eCommerce Data to HubSpot

put.description: Signal the end of an import for a given {objectType}. Once this call has been made, HubSpot will start processing the data for {objectType} within the context of this import.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

get.description: Retrieve a previously sent page of data from a batch import.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

put.description: Send a page of data for batch import. You are responsible for ensuring the uniqueness of the pageNumber within an importStartedAt/objectType combination.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

get.description: Read the import settings, such as import URI that will be called when an import starts for a given app. Use your Developer HAPI Key to make this request.

importTriggerUri.description: The URI of your service that will be called when an import begins.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

put.description: Update the import settings, such as import URI that will be called when an import starts for a given app. Use your Developer HAPI Key to make this request.

importTriggerUri.description: The URI of your service that will be called when an import begins.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

importTriggerUri.description: The URI of your service that will be called when an import begins.

post.description: Enable eCommerce functionality and add eCommerce properties, reporting dashboard, and email templates to your portal. Use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

get.description: Check whether your portal has settings enabled and eCommerce functionality installed. Your portal will not be able to receive sync messages until both are true. Use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

post.description: Disable eCommerce specific functionality, such as eCommerce workflows, from your portal. Use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

get.description: Read the sync settings for a given app or portal. As an application developer, use your developer HAPI Key to make this request. As a customer developer, use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

propertyName.description: The name of the data field as defined in your system.

dataType.description: The type of this property. One of STRING, NUMBER, DATETIME, AVATAR_IMAGE.

targetHubspotProperty.description: The internal name of the HubSpot property to map to.

items.description: Defines a mapping between a property in your system and a property in the HubSpot CRM.

put.description: Update the sync settings for a given app or portal. This will update the settings for all portals with your app installed, and changes to properties will be applied within the next few hours. As an application developer, use your developer HAPI Key to make this request. As a customer developer, use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

delete.description: Delete the sync settings for a given app or portal. This cannot be undone, so it is recommended that if you would like to disable sync messages from being applied using your property mappings that you disable your settings rather than deleting them. As an application developer, use your developer HAPI Key to make this request. As a customer developer, use your portal HAPI Key to make this request.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets
